Definition: Operated  by is the role of a a device in that an agent uses or controls.
Operates is the role of a person which controls or uses a device in an agent role.

Any material sample taken from a biological entity for testing, diagnostic, propagation, treatment or research purposes, including a sample obtained from a living organism or taken from the biological object after halting of all its life functions. Biospecimen can contain one or more components including but not limited to cellular molecules, cells, tissues, organs, body fluids, embryos, and body excretory products
Editors Notes: Note that any whole entity cannot be a biospecimen

Definition: A document that is an affine projection to a two dimensional surface, of EM spectrum radiation or measurements of some quality of an entity or entities repeated at regular intervals across a spatial range (where the measurements are represented as color and luminosity on the projected  surface.)
Editors Notes: Modified from IAO image definition and its stated relationship to the concept of document.  Another source that was used to develop this definition is http://vocab.getty.edu/page/aat/300264387 which defines image as  (quoting) Depictions and representations on a surface in two dimensions or low relief, or digital, whether the optical counterpart exists in reality or only in imagination. For example, the term may refer to a depiction as distinguished from its support, as when referring to a drawing as distinct from the paper upon which it is drawn.

Definition: An item of hardware that is a part of another item of hardware.
A data product that is an aggregate of data items of the same type that have something in common. Averages and distributions can be determined for data sets.

SubClass Of: IAO:0000027|'part of' some 'space life sciences dataset'
Definition: A set of related data (either written or electronic) and is a part of a dataset
A physical or digital representation of a body of information intended to be understood as a whole and conveyed primarily through the use of human-readable written language.
Editors Notes: "By this definition no binary files are documents (we assume they become dataset files in NGLSDA)"

SubClass Of: has participant' some biospecimen|'has participant' some institution|(investigates some 'research area')|'has participant' some personnel|'has participant' some payload|'has participant' some subject|(fundedBy some 'administrative program')|(generates some 'space life sciences dataset')|obo:OBI_0000066|prov:Activity|(managedAt some 'nasa center')|'part of' some 'research mission'
Definition: A coordinated set of actions and observations designed to generate data, with the ultimate goal of discovery or hypothesis testing.
Any document (electronic or written record) that is about an experiment process (limited to the conduct of the experiment)

SubClass Of: part of' some payload|OBI:0000968|('participates in' some 'research mission')|('operated by' some personnel)
Definition: A physical, manufactured or otherwise processed object that is used in a scientific investigation or clinical activity.
A document that is about an item of hardware.  For LSDA, hardware documents include hardware design, manufacturing, and operations documents
An individual who conducts scientific research.  The investigator collects and analyses data and study documents, and provides reports in compliance with applicable requirements

NCIT Definition: An established society, corporation, foundation or other organization founded and united for a specific purpose, e.g. for health-related research; also used to refer to a building or buildings occupied or used by such organization. CDISC Definition: An established society, corporation, foundation or other organization founded and united for a specific purpose, e.g. for health-related research; also used to refer to a building or buildings occupied or used by such organization. MGED Definition: A contacts affiliation, e.g. university, research institute or business.
A federally funded facility where NASA activities are undertaken.
Editors Notes: This would include JPL and other federally funded Centers. Is that in line with NGLSDA usage?

Definition: A document that is about a mission.  For LSDA, mission documents include mission personnel, operations, schedules, and other related documents.

SubClass Of: https://www.commoncoreontologies.org/ont00000556|('participates in' some experiment)|('participates in' some 'research mission')|('has part' some hardware)
Definition: A package of elements carried onboard a spacecraft over and above what is necessary for the operation of the vehicle.  May refer to the complete set of such elements transported during a mission, or to individual packages transported to support specific mission objectives.  A research payload refers to a package of elements specifically dedicated to producing research data and relaying that data to earth.
Editors Notes: Payloads are self-contained, and removable, and their presences is independent of vehicle operation.  The definition of payload is entwined with definition of vehicle, as vehicle is the transporting method/artifact associated with one or more payloads.

SubClass Of: ('participates in' some experiment)|('member of' some institution)|('member of' some 'nasa center')|'Homo sapiens'|(operates some payload)|http://xmlns.com/foaf/0.1/Agent|(operates some hardware)
Definition: Persons employed in any field.
NCIt Definition: A regularly issued printed or electronic report describing a main topic of interest to its subscribers.
TBD
Editors Notes: Currently not in NGLSDA.  (Dan to review with John)

Definition: An agent, commonly entirely within an organization, responsible for enabling one or more realizable entities.
A document that is about a project.  For LSDA, project documents include project operations, schedules, and other related documents.

NCIt Definition: A printed or electronic work offered for distribution. MSH Definition: Copies of a work or document distributed to the public by sale, rental, lease, or lending. (From ALA Glossary of Library and Information Science, 1983, p181)  CSP Definition: copy or copies of a document offered for distribution; includes the preparation of the documented material.
Indicates the scientific area addressed by the study.  This clas is maintained by NASA Life Sciences Data Archive.

SubClass Of: ('has part' some experiment)|'planned process'|('has participant' some payload)|('has participant' some hardware)|('has participant' some personnel)
Definition: Coordinated tasks and operations undertaken to meet a set of specific scientific or technical objectives, within clearly delineated time and location constraints.
Definition Source: Modified from SMD Catalog definition of Mission

Definition: The name applied to a plant, animal, or other organism, according to the Codes of Nomenclature, consisting of a Genus and species.
A type of document, physical or digital, comprised of data and/or analytical assessment related to a scientific protocol.
Editors Notes: Scientific documents can be referenced or included in publicationDocuments.

Definition: Devices, manned and unmanned, which are designed to be placed into an orbit about the Earth or into a trajectory to another celestial body.

SubClass Of: ('participates in' some experiment)|OBI:0100026|'scientific name'|(has_genotype some obo:GENO_0000536)
Definition: An entity of interest, either biological or otherwise. EXAMPLE(S): A human being who might be of interest because they are on a study, a sheep who might have experienced an adverse event, or a pacemaker that failed. An entity, either biologic or otherwise, of interest in an investigation. [Definition Source: NCI]

A bounded physical or digital representation of a body of information designed with the capacity (and usually intent) to communicate a particular subject, art, craft, technique, applied science and/or industrial service.
A person responsible for the overall conduct of a study
How long something or someone has existed; measured at launch/start

SubClass Of: http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/SLSO_0000032|('capable of' some 'low earth orbit space flight')
Definition: A vehicle operating or capable of operating in an extraterrestrial environment between the Earth's atmosphere and the innermost Earth radiation belt

SubClass Of: http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/SLSO_0000032|('capable of' some 'beyond low earth orbit space flight')
Definition: A vehicle operating or capable of operating in an extraterrestrial environment beyond the Earth's radiation belts.
A vehicle which traverses or is capable of traversing the boundary between the atmosphere and space without reaching low earth orbit.
Activity carried out by crewed or robotic vehicles outside the Earth's atmmosphere.
Editors Notes: There is no universally accepted definition of where space begins. Some definitions use the Kármán line, a somewhat arbitrary boundary approximately 62 miles (100 kilometers) above sea level. The US FAA (https://www.faa.gov/space/human_spaceflight) does not define where space begins, but recognizes "any flight crew or space flight participant who is on an FAA-licensed launch or reentry vehicle and reaches 50 statute miles above the surface of the Earth" by listing their name on the FAA Commercial Human Space Flight Recognition web page (https://www.faa.gov/space/human_spaceflight/recognition/).

Definition: Activity carried out by crewed or robotic vehicles outside the Earth's atmosphere but inside the Earth's inner radiation belt.

NGLSDA label: beyond low earth orbit space flight
Definition: Activity carried out by crewed or robotic vehicles outside the Earth's inner radiation belt.
A flight within the atmosphere of the Earth or another body where an aircraft describes a series of parabolic arcs lasting on the order of tens of seconds to simulate microgravity

A flight in which a vehicle, launched from either the ground or from an aircraft, has a trajectory which carries it above a substantial part of the  atmosphere but does not reach orbit. The occupants and/or contents experience a period (typically minutes) of microgravity by virtue of being in free fall.
a self-contained unit of a spacecraft
A self-contained unit of the International Space Station.
example of usage: The experiment was conducted in the International Space Station module Columbus|The experiment was conducted on the Russian module of the ISS.

Definition: A spacecraft capable of supporting a human crew in orbit for an extended period of time. It lacks major propulsion or landing systems. Stations must have docking ports to allow other spacecraft to dock to transfer crew and supplies.
example of usage: Mir was a space station that operated in low Earth orbit from 1986 to 2001, operated by the Soviet Union and later by Russia.

Definition: A form or variant of an original hardware object or object type; one of a sequence of iterations of a hardware object, each incorporating new modifications.
A form or variant of a type or original; one of a sequence of copies of a program, each incorporating new modifications.
A version of an object that is distinguished from other versions by its specific capabilities.
An organization with the capability to fund one or more realizable entities.
An administrative program with the capability to fund one or more realizable entities.
An identifiable part of an organization with the capability to fund one or more realizable entities.
A planned process to execute a series of spaceflights.
A wearable active dosimeter, based on direct ion storage technology, for use by spacecraft crewmembers.
